Detailed Description

POSIX interface to thread. 

    #include "kaapi"

    // A thread that could be joined, with a weak semantics than Posix semantics.
    class JoinableThread : public Util::Thread, public Util::Mutex, public Util::Condition {
      Foo_TYPE _arg;
      Foo_TYPE _retval;
    public:
      // Create a new thread object and pass some parameters
      JoinableThread( const Foo_TYPE& parameter ) 
       : _arg(parameter) 
      { 
        Util::Thread::initialize(); 
        Util::Mutex::initialize();
        Util::Condition::initialize();
      }
      
      // Destroy the object
      ~MyThread() {
        Util::Thread::terminate(); 
        Util::Mutex::terminate();
        Util::Condition::terminate();
      }

      // definition of pure virtual Thread::run
      void run() 
      {
        try {
          // .. do something
        } catch(...) {
        }
        
        { Util::CriticalGuard critical( *this );
          // this is a call to the inherited method Condition::signal 
          signal();
        }
      }

      // join method: assume that mutex of this is locked before the thread was started
      Foo_TYPE& join() throw(PosixError)
      {
        // this is a call to the inherited Condition::wait( Mutex& )
        wait( *this );
        // return the value
        return _retval;
      }
    };

    int main()
    {
      try {
        // initialize the library and the mutex
        Util::Init::initialize();

        // Create and initialize the MyThread object
        MyThread thread(some_parameters);
        
        // Ok start the new thread of control
        { Util::CriticalGuard critical( thread );
          thread.start();    
          std::cout << "Result is:" << thread.join() << std::endl;
        }

        Util::Init::terminate();

        return 0;
      } catch (const Util::PosixError& ex) {
        std::cerr << "[Catch]:" << ex.what() << std::endl;
      } catch (const Util::Exception& ex) {
        std::cerr << "[Catch]:" << ex.what() << std::endl;
      } catch (...) {
        std::cerr << "[Catch] unknown error" << std::endl;
      }
      return -1;
    }

void Util::Thread::resume ( Thread *  thread  )  throw ()

Current running thread resume the thread 'thread' This instruction is not a swap, the context of the running thread is not saved.

virtual void Util::Thread::run (  )  [pure virtual]

Entry point executed by new started thread of control. This method is call when a new thread of control has been sucessfully created and started. Because a new thread cannot be join (as Posix do), no return value are required. Passing parameters to the thread reported to object creation of a derived class from Thread class.

Implemented in Util::EventDaemon, Util::EventBufferManager, Core::Thread, Core::Processor, FDNET::Device::Dispatcher, MANET::Device::Dispatcher, MYNET::Device::Request_Handler, Net::IODaemon, SOCKNET::Device::Dispatcher, SOCKNET::Device::Scavanger, TAKTUKNET::Device::Dispatcher, UDPNET::Device::Dispatcher, FT::CCKCheckpointCoordinator, FT::CCKLocalCheckpointController, FT::CCKGlobalRestartCoordinator, FT::CCKGlobalRestartLocalController, FT::CCKRestartCoordinator, FT::CCKRestartLocalController, FT::CheckpointServer, and FT::TICRestart.

static bool Util::Thread::sleep ( long  milli,
long  nano = 0 
) throw () [static]

Current thread yield the processor for an given delay A call to this method suspends the running thread for at most the given delay. The delay is expressed in term of millisecond and nanosecond. If the method returns because the requested time has elasped the value returned is false. If the method returns due to an interruption then the value returned is true. The method never throw exception.

Parameters:
milli a long integer that specifies the number of milli second to sleep
nano a long integer that specifies the number of nano second to sleep
Return values:
true iff the suspended thread was wakeup due to interruption
false if the thread was suspended for at most the given delay
void Util::Thread::start ( void(Thread::*)()  method  )  throw (PosixError) [inline, virtual]

Start a thread object that execute a redefinition of the run method. The method creates a new thread of control that may be executed with concurrence to other one. The created thread is not joinable which differ from default Posix thread creation.

Parameters:
method a pointer to the method of the class Thread or derived class
Exceptions:
PosixError with error code if error occurs
void Util::Thread::start (  )  throw (PosixError) [inline, virtual]

Start a thread object that execute the overloaded run method. The method creates a new thread of control that may be executed with concurrence to other one. The created thread is not joinable which differ from default Posix thread creation.

Exceptions:
PosixError with error code if error occurs

Reimplemented in Core::Processor, SOCKNET::Device::Dispatcher, and SOCKNET::Device::Scavanger.
